ygData.subject: Re: Purpose of wizard class (short, maybe small spoiler)
ygData.msgSnippet: we are usually one rank ahead of the rest of the classes as far as dd goes. the druids lvl 29 dd spell does about the same dmg as our lvl 20 and 24 spells
ygData.messageBody:
we are usually one rank ahead of the rest of the classes as far as dd goes.
the druids lvl 29 dd spell does about the same dmg as our lvl 20 and 24
spells (force/frost shock). the enchanters lvl 24 spell does less than our
lvl 20 spell. and also keep in mind that other classes dmg/mana ratio is
not near as efficient as the wizards. the wizards spells can also be cast
much quicker :) i can only speak of other classes up to about lvl 29,
because i havent grouped with anybody higher, or havent had first hand
knowledge of higher lvl spells. with that being said, i dont think that a
magician gets a spell that does 950 dmg. i think most of the classes dd
spells max out at around 500 to 550 at lvl 49 (which is a little lower than
what our lvl 44 dd spells do). please correct me if i'm wrong tho :)

Sinlaru Ce`alen
Rallos Zek

ps. pets are highly overrated at higher lvls because of the grouping
requirements and the limited hunting areas... and in a big group in a
dungeon, u pretty much put the pets back in ur spell books :)

-----Original Message-----
From: MAD Iguana <wargod@...>
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Date: Sunday, June 27, 1999 3:22 AM
Subject: [eq_wizards] Purpose of wizard class (short, maybe small spoiler)


>From: MAD Iguana <wargod@...>
>
>I know that the purpose of the wizard class is to do heavy damage quickly.
>A friend of mine was telling me that mages do almost the same damage plus
>they have a pet to fight for them. He does close dmg to me now at lvl 20.
>He says at lvl 49 mages do lava bolt which does 950 whereas ice comet does
>1100. That is almost the same damage as the wizard. So it seems to me
>that there isn't much of a use to be a wizard if you can be a mage and do
>almost the same amount of direct damage plus you have a pet. So anyone
>tell me something good about the wiz class to make it worth playing them to
>high levels?
>
